p: Human-mediated transport for tourism or trade provides introduction pathways and therefore contributes to the rising number of introductions of alien species [ 18, 19]. Increases of biological invasions were found to coincide with the industrial revolution [ 18, 20, 21] and unprecedented acceleration of merchandise trade within the last 50 years led to progressive increases in the introduction of alien species [ 18]. Biological invasions are assumed to increase in the future in response to globalisation and climate change [ 18, 20– 23]. Climate change is widely considered to exacerbate the impact of invasive species by making additional space suitable, enhancing survival and reproduction success, and by improving the competitive capacity of non-indigenous species [ 9, 24– 26].
